register.description: This register, with, stores the 14-bit divisor for generation of the baud clock in the baud rate generator. DLH stores the most-significant part of the divisor. DLL stores the least-significant part of the divisor.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Stores the 8-bit LSB divisor value

register.description: The receiver section consists of the receiver holding register (RHR) and the receiver shift register. The RHR is a 64-byte FIFO. The receiver shift register receives serial data from RX input. The data is converted to parallel data and moved to the RHR. If the FIFO is disabled, location 0 of the FIFO stores the single data character.Note:If an overflow occurs, the data in the RHR is not overwritten.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0
Receive holding register

register.description: The transmitter section consists of the transmit holding register (THR) and the transmit shift register. The THR is a 64-byte FIFO. The local host (LH) writes data to the THR. The data is placed in the transmit shift register where it is shifted out serially on the TX output. If the FIFO is disabled, location 0 of the FIFO stores the data.

bitfield.description: Write has no effect.
Transmit holding register

register.description: This register, with, stores the 14-bit divisor for generating the baud clock in the baud rate generator. DLH stores the most-significant part of the divisor. DLL stores the least-significant part of the divisor.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Stores the 6-bit MSB divisor value
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.

bitenum.description: Enables sleep mode (stop baud rate clock when the module is inactive)
Disables the modem status register interrupt
Enables the modem status register interrupt
Disables the receiver line status interrupt
Enables the receiver line status interrupt
Disables the RHR interrupt and time-out interrupt
Enables the RHR interrupt and time-out interrupt

bitfield.description: Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Auto-CTS enable bit

bitenum.description: Auto-CTS flow control is enabled. Transmission is halted when the CTS* pin is high (inactive).

bitfield.description: Auto-RTS enable bit

bitenum.description: Auto-RTS flow control is enabled. RTS* pin goes high (inactive) when the RX FIFO HALT trigger level,[3:0], is reached, and goes low (active) when the RX FIFO RESTORE transmission trigger level is reached.

Special character detect enable. Received data is compared with XOFF2 data. If a match occurs, the received data is transferred to the RX FIFO and the[4] bit is set to 1 to indicate that a special character was detected.

bitfield.description: Enhanced functions write enable bit

bitenum.description: Disables writing to IER bits 4-7, bits 4-5, and MCR bits 5-7.
Enables writing to IER bits 4-7, bits 4-5, and MCR bits 5-7.

bitfield.description: Combinations of software flow control can be selected by programming bit 3 - bit 0. See.
Write has no effect.

Sets the trigger level for the RX FIFO:If UART_SCR[7] = 0 and UART_TLR[7:4] = 0000:00: 8 characters 01: 16 characters 10: 56 characters 11: 60 characters If UART_SCR[7] = 0 and UART_TLR[7:4] != 0000, RX_FIFO_TRIG is not considered. If UART_SCR[7] = 1, RX_FIFO_TRIG is 2 LSBs of the trigger level (1-63 on 6 bits) with the granularity 1.

Sets the trigger level for the TX FIFO:If UART_SCR[6] = 0 and UART_TLR[3:0] = 0000: 00: 8 spaces 01: 16 spaces 10: 32 spaces 11: 56 spaces If UART_SCR[6] = 0 and UART_TLR[3:0] != 0000, TX_FIFO_TRIG is not considered. If UART_SCR[6] = 1, TX_FIFO_TRIG is 2 LSBs of the trigger level (1-63 on 6 bits) with the granularity 1
This register is considered ifUART_SCR[0] = 0.

bitenum.description: DMA_MODE 1 (UART_nDMA_REQ[0] in TX, UART_nDMA_REQ[1] in RX)
Clears the TX FIFO and resets its counter logic to 0. Returns to 0 after clearing FIFO.
Clears the RX FIFO and resets its counter logic to 0. Returns to 0 after clearing FIFO.
Disables the transmit and RX FIFOs. The transmit and receive holding registers are 1-byte FIFOs.
Enables the transmit and RX FIFOs. The transmit and receive holding registers are 64-byte FIFOs.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Mirror the contents ofUART_FCR[0] on both bits.
Read 0x0: Modem interrupt. Priority = 4

bitenum.description: CTS, RTS, DSR change state from active (low) to inactive (high) Priority = 6

bitfield.description: Read 0x0: An interrupt is pending.
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.

bitenum.description: Divisor latch enable. Allows access to DLL, DLH, and other registers (see and ).

bitfield.description: Break control bit

bitenum.description: Forces the transmitter output to go low to alert the communication terminal

bitfield.description: Selects the forced parity format (ifUART_LCR[3] = 1). If UART_LCR[5] = 1 and UART_LCR[4] = 0, the parity bit is forced to 1 in the transmitted and received data. If UART_LCR[5] = 1 and UART_LCR[4] = 1, the parity bit is forced to 0 in the transmitted and received data.
0x0: No parity

bitenum.description: A parity bit is generated during transmission and the receiver checks for received parity.

bitfield.description: Specifies the number of stop-bits
Specifies the word length to be transmitted or received
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
0x0: No action

bitenum.description: Enables access to the and registers

bitfield.description: 0x0: Disable XON any function.
0x0: Normal operating mode

bitenum.description: Enable local loopback mode (internal). In this mode, the MCR[3:0] signals are looped back into the[7:4] bit field. The transmit output is looped back to the receive input internally.

bitfield.description: 0x0: In loopback, forces DCD* input high and IRQ outputs to inactive state

bitenum.description: In loopback, forces DCD* input low and IRQ outputs to inactive state

bitfield.description: 0x0: In loopback, forces RI* input high

bitenum.description: In loopback, forces RI* input low

bitfield.description: In loopback, controls theUART_MSR[4] bit. If auto-RTS is enabled, the RTS* output is controlled by hardware flow control.
0x0: Force DTR* output to inactive (high).

register.description: UART mode: XON1 character, IrDA mode: ADDR1 address

bitfield.description: Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Stores the 8-bit XON1 character in UART modes and ADDR1 address 1 for IrDA modes
Read returns 0.
Read 0x0: Normal operation

bitenum.description: At least one parity error, framing error, or break indication in the RX FIFO. Bit 7 is cleared when no more errors are present in the RX FIFO.

bitfield.description: Read 0x0: Transmitter hold (TX FIFO) and shift registers are not empty.

bitenum.description: Transmitter hold (TX FIFO) and shift registers are empty.

bitfield.description: Read 0x0: Transmit hold register (TX FIFO) is not empty.

bitenum.description: Transmit hold register (TX FIFO) is empty. The transmission is not necessarily complete.

bitfield.description: Read 0x0: No break condition

bitenum.description: A break was detected while the data from the RX FIFO was received (for example, RX input was low for one character + 1 bit time frame).

bitfield.description: Read 0x0: No framing error in data RX FIFO

bitenum.description: Framing error occurred in data from RX FIFO (received data did not have a valid stop-bit).

bitfield.description: Read 0x0: No parity error in data from RX FIFO

bitenum.description: Parity error in data from RX FIFO

bitfield.description: Read 0x0: No overrun error

bitenum.description: Overrun error occurred. Set when the character in the receive shift register is not transferred to the RX FIFO. This occurs only when the RX FIFO is full.

bitfield.description: Read 0x0: No data in the RX FIFO

bitenum.description: At least one data character in the RX FIFO

register.description: Stores the 8-bit XON2 character in UART moldes and ADDR2 address 2 for IrDA modes

bitfield.description: Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Stores the 8-bit XON2 character in UART modes and ADDR2 address 2 for IrDA modes

register.description: Modem status register. UART mode only.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.
This bit is the complement of the DCD* input. In loopback mode, it is equivalent toUART_MCR[3].
This bit is the complement of the RI* input. In loopback mode, it is equivalent toUART_MCR[2].
This bit is the complement of the DSR* input. In loopback mode, it is equivalent toUART_MCR[0].
This bit is the complement of the CTS* input. In loopback mode, it is equivalent toUART_MCR[1].
Indicates that DCD* input (orUART_MCR[3] in loopback) changed. Cleared on a read.
Indicates that RI* input (orUART_MCR[2] in loopback) changed state from low to high. Cleared on a read.

bitenum.description: Indicates that DSR* input (or[0] in loopback) changed state. Cleared on a read.
Indicates that CTS* input (or[1] in loopback) changed state. Cleared on a read.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
RX FIFO trigger level to RESTORE transmission (0 - 60)
RX FIFO trigger level to HALT transmission (0 - 60)
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Stores the 8-bit XOFF1 character used in UART modes
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Scratchpad register
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Receive FIFO trigger level
Transmit FIFO trigger level
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Stores the 8-bit XOFF2 character used in UART modes.
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
IrDA mode only
MIR/FIR modes only

bitenum.description: Manual SIP mode: SIP is generated with the control of ACREG[3].
Automatic SIP mode: SIP is generated after each transmission.

bitfield.description: Store and control the transmission.

bitenum.description: Starts the infrared transmission when a value is written to THR
Starts the infrared transmission with the control of ACREG[2]. Note: Before starting any transmission, there must be no reception ongoing.

bitfield.description: Used to configure the infrared transceiver

bitenum.description: a) No action if MDR2[7] = 0 b) TXIR pin output is forced low if MDR2[7] = 1.
IRTX pin output is forced high (not dependent on MDR2[7] value).

bitfield.description: 0x0: IrDA/CIR sleep mode disabled
0x0: UART 16x mode
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Provide alternate function for MDR1[4] (SET_TXIR).
IR mode only (IrDA and CIR). Invert RX pin in the module before the voting or sampling system logic of the infrared block. This does not affect the RX path in UART modem modes.
CIR pulse modulation definition. Defines high level of the pulse width associated with a digit:
UART mode only. Allows pulse shaping in UART mode.

bitenum.description: UART mode with a pulse shaping

bitfield.description: IR-IrDA mode only. Frame status FIFO threshold select:
IrDA transmission status interrupt. When theUART_IIR[5] interrupt occurs, the meaning of the interrupt is:

bitenum.description: The last bit of the frame transmitted successfully without error.
An underrun occurred. The last bit of the frame was transmitted but with an underrun error. The bit is reset to 0 when the register is read.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.
Read returns 0.
Read 0x1: Overrun error in RX FIFO when frame at top of RX FIFO was received Top of RX FIFO = Next frame to be read from RX FIFO
Read 0x1: Frame-length too long error in frame at top of RX FIFO
Read 0x1: Abort pattern detected in frame at top of RX FIFO
Read 0x1: CRC error in frame at top of RX FIFO
Write has no effect.
LSB register used to specify the frame length

register.description: IR-IrDA and IR-CIR modes only. This register is used to clear internal flags, which halt transmission/reception when an underrun/overrun error occurs. Reading this register resumes the halted operation. This register does not physically exist and reads always as 0x00.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.
Dummy read to restart the TX or RX
Write has no effect.
Write has no effect.
MSB register used to specify the frame length
Write has no effect.
LSB register used to specify the frame length in reception
Read returns 0.
LSB part of the frame length
Write has no effect.
Write has no effect.
MSB register used to specify the frame length in reception
Read returns 0.
Read returns 0.
MSB part of the frame length
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Status FIFO reset. This bit is self-clearing.
SIR xBOF select
Read returns 0.
Read returns 0.
Read 0x0: No parity identified
Read 0x0: 7-bit character identified
Used to report the speed identified

register.description: Auxiliary control register. IR-IrDA and IR-CIR modes only.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
SIR pulse width select
Primary output used to configure transceivers. Connected to the SD/MODE input pin of IrDA transceivers.

bitenum.description: SD pin is set to high.
SD pin is set to low.

bitfield.description: 0x0: Normal operation (RX input automatically disabled during transmit but enabled outside of transmit operation)

bitenum.description: Disables RX input (permanent state - independent of transmit)

bitfield.description: It is recommended to disable TX FIFO underrun capability by masking corresponding underrun interrupt. When disabling underrun by setting ACREG[4] = 1, garbage data is sent over TX line.

bitenum.description: Long stop-bits cannot be transmitted; TX underrun is enabled.
Long stop-bits can be transmitted; TX underrun is disabled.

bitfield.description: MIR/FIR modes only. Send serial infrared interaction pulse (SIP). If this bit is set during an MIR/FIR transmission, the SIP is sent at the end of it. This bit is cleared automatically at the end of the SIP transmission.
Store and controlled TX start. When MDR1[5] = 1 and the LH writes 1 to this bit, the TX state-machine starts frame transmission. This bit is self-clearing.

Frame abort. The LH can intentionally abort transmission of a frame by writing 1 to this bit. Neither the end flag nor the CRC bits are appended to the frame. If TX FIFO is not empty and MDR1[5] = 1, UART IrDA starts a new transfer with data of the previous frame when the abort frame is sent. Therefore, TX FIFO must be reset before sending an abort frame.

EOT (end of transmission) bit. The LH writes 1 to this bit just before it writes the last byte to the TX FIFO in set-EOT bit frame closing method. This bit is cleared automatically when the LH writes to the THR (TX FIFO).
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
0x0: Disables the granularity of 1 for trigger RX level

bitenum.description: Enables the granularity of 1 for trigger RX level

bitfield.description: 0x0: Disables the granularity of 1 for trigger TX level

bitenum.description: Enables the granularity of 1 for trigger TX level

bitfield.description: 0x0: Disables DSR* interrupt
0x0: Disables the wake-up interrupt and clears SSR[1]

bitenum.description: Waits for a falling edge of pins RX, CTS*, or DSR* to generate an interrupt

bitfield.description: 0x0: Normal mode for THR interrupt (seeUART mode interrupts table)

bitenum.description: The THR interrupt is generated when TX FIFO and TX shift register are empty.

bitfield.description: Used to specify the DMA mode valid if theUART_SCR[0] bit = 1

bitenum.description: DMA mode 1 (UART_nDMA_REQ[0] in TX, UART_nDMA_REQ[1] in RX)

bitfield.description: 0x0: The DMA_MODE is set withUART_FCR[3].
Read returns 0.
Read returns 0.
0x0: The DMA counter will not be reset if the corresponding FIFO is reset (through FCR[1] or FCR[2]).

bitenum.description: The DMA counter will be reset if corresponding FIFO is reset (through FCR[1] or FCR[2]).

bitfield.description: Read 0x0: No falling edge event on RX, CTS*, and DSR*

bitenum.description: A falling edge occurred on RX, CTS*, or DSR*.

bitfield.description: Read 0x0: TX FIFO is not full.
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
IR-IrDA mode: This register allows definition of up to 176 xBOFs, the maximum required by IrDA specification.
Revision number
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Read returns 0.
Power management req/ack control ref:OCP Design Guidelines Version 1.1

bitenum.description: Force-idle: Idle request is acknowledged unconditionally.
No-idle: Idle request is never acknowledged.
Smart-idle: Idle request is acknowledged based in module internal activity.
Smart-idle Wake-up: Acknowledgement to an idle request is given based in the internal activity of the module. The module is allowed to generate wake-up request.

bitfield.description: Wake-up feature control
Software reset. Set this bit to 1 to trigger a module reset. This bit is automatically reset by the hardware. Read returns 0.
Internal OCP clock gating strategy

bitenum.description: Automatic OCP clock gating strategy is applied, based on OCP interface activity

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.
Read returns 0.
Internal reset monitoring
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
0x0: Event is not allowed to wake up the system.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0. Write has no effect.

System clock frequency prescaler at (12x multiple). Examples for CFPS values:Target Freq (kHz) CFPS (decimal) Actual Freq (kHz) . 30 133 30.08 . 32.75 122 32.79 . 36 111 36.04 . 36.7 109 36.69 . 38* 105 38.1 . 40 100 40 . 56.8 70 57.14 . *configured at reset to this value . Note:CFPS = 0 is not supported. .
Read returns 0.
Shows the number of received bytes in the RX FIFO
Read returns 0.
Shows the number of written bytes in the TX FIFO

register.description: Enables RX/TX FIFOs empty corresponding interrupts

bitfield.description: Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Enables TX FIFO empty corresponding interrupt
Enables RX FIFO empty corresponding interrupt

register.description: Status of RX/TX FIFOs empty corresponding interrupts

bitfield.description: Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Used to generate interrupt if the TX_FIFO is empty (software flow control)
Used to generate interrupt if the RX_FIFO is empty (software flow control)
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Sets the sample per bit if nondefault frequency is used. MDR3[1] must be set to 1 after this value is set. Must be equal to or higher then 6.
Read returns 0. Write has no effect.
Enable to set different TXDMA threshold inUART_TX_DMA_THRESHOLD register.
Used to enable the NONDEFAULT fclk frequencies.

bitenum.description: Enables using NONDEFAULT fclk frequencies (set FREQ_SEL and DLH/DLL).

bitfield.description: Used to enable CIR RX demodulation.

register.description: Use to manually set the TX DMA threshold level. [2] SET_TX_DMA_THRESHOLD must be 1 and must be value + tx_trigger_level = 64 (TX FIFO size).If not, 64-tx_trigger_level will be used without modifying the value of this register.

bitfield.description: Used to manually set the TX DMA threshold level
